docs.lead_paragraph: Assemblyman William L. Parment drives his 1989 Chevy, a harmonica on the dashboard and 121,600 miles on the odometer, around the hills of his district these days trying to figure out what his voters want. He is a Democrat who won re-election unopposed, but his constituents also voted overwhelmingly for the new Republican Governor, George E. Pataki. And therein lies his quandary: Does support for Mr. Pataki in his district translate into support for Mr. Pataki's deep-cutting budget?
